benchmark_details.name: SECVULEVAL
benchmark_details.overview: SECVULEVAL is a comprehensive benchmark designed for evaluating fine-grained vulnerability detection in C/C++ by focusing on real-world vulnerabilities at the statement level with rich contextual information.

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: To provide a reliable benchmark for evaluating the capability of LLMs in detecting security vulnerabilities in C/C++ projects.

data.source: C/C++ vulnerabilities from the National Vulnerability Database (NVD) and GitHub commits.
data.annotation: Automatically extracted and contextual information added using LLMs.

methodology.calculation: Metrics are calculated based on the comparison of the model outputs against the ground truth in the dataset.
methodology.interpretation: Higher scores indicate better model performance in detecting vulnerabilities.
methodology.validation: The benchmark ensures rigorous validation through a multi-agent system.

targeted_risks.harm: Potential misuse by malicious users for exploitation of vulnerabilities.
